definition: Jianshi or Chienshih township in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
Jianshi or Chienshih township in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan

sentences.english: Fortified Obelisks have higher health and can better protect Strategic Points.
sentences.chinese: 加強的方尖石塔有較高的健康而且能更保護策略的點。

sentences.english: In this vision, Ida sits at the cusp.
sentences.chinese: 在這幅圖中，艾達坐在一塊尖石之上。

sentences.english: Take a good look at this obelisk. In whose honour was it erected?
sentences.chinese: 仔細看一下這座方尖石塔。它是爲誰而建的？

sentences.english: Take a good look at this obelisk.
sentences.chinese: 仔細看一下這座方尖石塔。

sentences.english: Fortified Obelisks gain the Wailing Doom ability.
sentences.chinese: 加強的方尖石塔得到悲嘆命運能力。

sentences.english: They also made tools of bones and sharpened stones.
sentences.chinese: 他們還使用骨頭和尖石做成工具。

sentences.english: One passes under pyramids and obelisks, all on a heroic scale.
sentences.chinese: 一個人經過規模宏大的金字塔和方尖石塔。

sentences.english: The sharp stones lacerated his feet.
Heavily Fortified Obelisks activate Gauss weaponry .
sentences.chinese: 很重加強的方尖石塔啓動高斯武器。

definition: crushed or broken rock, stone etc
